title: The One Where Rachel Finds Out

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Central Perk, the whole gang is there, Ross is showing pictures of his new baby
boy, Ben, to the group.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: And here's little Ben nodding off...

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Awww, look at Aunt Monica's little boy!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, look, he's got Ross's haircut!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, let me see! (grabs picture) Oh, God, is he just the sweetest thing? You must just want to kiss him all over!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (quietly) That would be nice.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Pardon?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Nothing, just a little extra air in my mouth. Pffft. Pffffffft. (walks over to where Joey is seated)

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey, Chan, can you help me out here? I promise I'll pay you back.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh, yeah, right, OK... inlcuding the waffles last week, you now owe me... 17 jillion dollars.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I will, really. I'll pay you back this time.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (sigh)... And where's this money coming from? (gives money to Joey)

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Well... I'm helping out down at the N.Y.U. Med School with some... research.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (overhearing) What kind of research?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Oh, just, y'know.... science.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Science. Yeah, I think I've heard of that. (everyone's interest is piqued, they all look over)

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (sigh)... It's a fertility study.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh, Joey, please tell me you're only donating your time .

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Alright, come on you guys, it's not that big a deal. Really... I mean, I just go down there every other day and... make my contribution to the project. Hey, hey, but at the end of two weeks, I get seven hundred dollars.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hey.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Wow, ooh, you're gonna be making money hand over fist!

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Central Perk, the whole gang is there, Ross is showing pictures of his new baby
boy, Ben, to the group.]

events.event_description: Ross shows pictures of his baby Ben to the group, pointing out his features.
Rachel grabs a picture of Ben and comments on how adorable he is.
Rachel asks Ross if he wants to kiss Ben all over.
Chandler makes a joke about having extra air in his mouth and walks over to Joey.
Chandler jokes about Joey owing him 17 jillion dollars including last week's waffles.
Joey assures Chandler he will pay him back this time.
Chandler questions where Joey's money is coming from and gives money to Joey.
Joey explains he is helping with a fertility study at NYU Med School.
Ross asks Joey what kind of research he is involved in.
Joey reveals he is participating in a fertility study and will earn seven hundred dollars after two weeks.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica and Phoebe are preparing for a barbecue for
Rachel's birthday.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: OK, we got the cole slaw, we got the buns...

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: We've got the ground-up flesh of formerly cute cows and turkeys, ew... (hands meat to Monica)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (in a deep voice) Men are here.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: We make fire. Cook meat.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Then put out fire by peeing, no get invited back.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA AND PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Ewww!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh Joey, Melanie called, said she's gonna be late.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Oh, OK.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: So how are things going with you two? Is she becoming your (provocatively) special someone?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I don't know, she's, uh.... she's pretty great.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Yeah? What does she think of your little science project?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: What, you think I'm gonna tell a girl I like that I'm also seeing a cup?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Man's got a point.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Well, the tough thing is, she really wants to have sex with me.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Crazy bitch.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah, well, I still got a week left to go in the program, and according to the rules, if I want to get the money I'm not allowed to conduct any... ersonal experiments, if you know what I mean.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Joey... we always know what you mean.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Hey.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Hey.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hey. (Phoebe sees his bags)

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: How long did you think this barbecue was gonna last?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I'm going to China.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Jeez, you say one thing, and...

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: You're going to China?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah, i-it's for the museum. Someone found a bone, we want the bone, but they don't want us to have the bone, so I'm going over there to try to persuade them to give us the bo—it's—it's a whole big bone thing. Anyway, I'm gonna be gone for like, uh... like a week, so, uh, if you wanna reach me, y-you can't. So here's my itinerary (hands a sheet of paper to Monica). Um... here's a picture of me... (hands it to Monica)

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, let me see! (takes the picture)

dialogue.speaker: TO MONICA)
dialogue.text: Could you take it to Carol's every now and then, and show it to Ben, just so he doesn't forget me?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Hi, Ben. I'm your father. I am... the head. Aaaaaahhhh.... (puts picture down, sees Ross staring at her) Alright, this barbecue is gonna be very fun.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hey, is Rachel here? Um, I wanted to wish her a happy birthday before I left.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh no, she's out having drinks with Carl.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh. (pause) Hey, who's Carl?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: You know, that guy she met at the coffeehouse.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, well, see, there's this guy she met at the...

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: At the coffeehouse, right.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: So you do know who he is! (laughs, Ross stares at her) Sorry.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: OK, I'm gonna go say goodbye to the guys.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, hey, y'know what? Tell them that bone story.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hi.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Hey!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (sigh)....I have to go to China.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: The country?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No no, this big pile of dishes in my mom's breakfront. Do you guys know who Carl is?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Uh, let's see... Alvin... Simon... Theodore.... no.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Well, Rachel's having drinks with him tonight.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Oh no! How can she do that when she's never shown any interest in you?!?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Forget about her.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: He's right, man. Please. Move on. Go to China. Eat Chinese food.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Course there, they just call it food.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah... I guess. I don't—I don't know. Alright, just... just give her this for me, OK? (gives Chandler a gift for Rachel)

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Listen, buddy, we're just looking out for you.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I know.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: We want you to be happy. And I may only have a couple beers in me, but... I love you, man. (Joey gives Ross a hug)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I'm still on my first. I just think you're nice.

dialogue.speaker: MELANIE
dialogue.text: Anyway, that's when me and my friends started this whole fruit basket business. We call ourselves 'The Three Basketeers.'

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Like the three musketeers, only with fruit.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (sarcastic) Ooooh. (looks dumbfounded at Joey's stupidity)

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (gets up) OK, how does everybody like their burgers?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, no, no, no. Presents first. Food later. (walks into living room)

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Hey, hold on there, tiger. How's it going? How you holding up?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Well, not so good. She definitely thinks tonight is the night we're gonna... complete the transaction, if you know what I...

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Then you do. Heh, heh.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: So, uh, have you ever thought about being there for her ?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: What do you mean?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Y'know, just be there for her .

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Not following you.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Think about it.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: OK, I'm guessing this is from...

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Well, thank you, Melanie.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (pointing out a gift) OK, this one right here is from me.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (picks it up) OK... ah, it's light... (shakes it)...it rattles... it's... (opens it) Travel Scrabble ! Oooohhh, thank you! (she gives it back to him)

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: This one's from Joey... feels like a book. Thinks it's a book... feels like a book. And...(opens it)...it's a book!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, it's Dr. Seuss!

dialogue.speaker: TO RACHEL)
dialogue.text: That book got me through some tough times.

dialogue.speaker: MELANIE
dialogue.text: There is a little child inside this man!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yes, the doctors say if they remove it, he'll die.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Who's this from?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh, that's Ross's.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh... (opens it)... (sees it is a pin) Oh my God. He remembered.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Remembered what?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: It was like months ago. We were walking by this antique store, and I saw this pin in the window, and I told him it was just like one my grandmother had when I was a little girl. Oh! I can't believe he remembered!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well, sure, but can you play it on a plane? (pats his Travel Scrabble game)

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, it's so pretty. This must have cost him a fortune.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I can't believe he did this.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Come on, Ross? Remember back in college, when he fell in love with Carol and bought her that ridiculously expensive crystal duck?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: What did you just say?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (panicked) ahem... um... Crystal duck.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: No, no, no.... the, um, the... 'love' part?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (stuttering incoherently) F-hah.... flennin....

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh.... my God.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (rubbing his temples) Oh, no-no-no-no-no....

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (pats Chandler on the leg) That's good, just keep rubbing your head. That'll turn back time.

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica and Phoebe are preparing for a barbecue for
Rachel's birthday.]

events.event_description: Monica and Phoebe prepare for Rachel's birthday barbecue by gathering food items like cole slaw and buns.
Chandler announces that the men are present at the scene.
Joey states that they will make fire and cook meat for the barbecue.
Chandler jokes that if Joey pees on the fire to put it out, he won't be invited back.
Monica informs Joey that Melanie called and will be late to the barbecue.
Ross announces he is going to China to persuade others to give the museum a bone they found.
Ross gives Monica a picture of himself to show to Ben while he is away.
Ross asks Monica to take the picture to Carol's and show it to Ben to prevent him from forgetting Ross.
Rachel's friends discuss her being out with Carl, and Phoebe mentions a story about a bone.
Ross gives Chandler a gift for Rachel before leaving for China, and Joey expresses concern for Ross's happiness.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, continued from earlier.]

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I mean, this is unbelievable.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I know. This is really, really huge.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: No it's not. It's small. It's tiny. It's petite. It's wee.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Nuh-uh. I don't think any of our lives are ever gonna be the same ever again.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: OK, is there a mute button on this woman?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I think this is so great! I mean, you and Ross! D-did you have any idea?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: No! None! I mean, my first night in the city, he mentioned something about asking me out, but nothing ever happened,

dialogue.speaker: SO I JUST... (TO JOEY)
dialogue.text: W-well, what else did he say? I mean, does he, like, want to go out with me?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Well, given that he's desperately in love with you, he probably wouldn't mind getting a cup of coffee or something.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Ross? All this time? Well, I've got to talk to him. (gets up to leave)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (quickly) H-He's in China!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: The country.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: No, no, wait. (checks Ross's itinerary) His flight doesn't leave for another forty-five more minutes.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: What about the time difference?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: From here to the airport?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yes! (Rachel walks towards door) You're never gonna make it!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Rachel, what're you gonna say to him?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I-I-I don't know.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well then maybe you shouldn't go.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: He's right, cause if you're just gonna, like, break his heart, that's the kind of thing that can wait.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Yeah, but if it's good news, you should tell him now.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I don't know. Maybe I'll know when I see him.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Here, look, alright, does this help?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Noooo... look, all I know is that I cannot wait a week until I see him. I mean, this is just too big. Y'know, I just, I've just gotta talk to him. I... I gotta... OK, I'll see you later. (opens door)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Rachel, I love you! Deal with me first! (she leaves)

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, continued from earlier.]

events.event_description: Rachel expresses her disbelief about the situation.
Phoebe acknowledges the significance of the situation.
Chandler dismisses the importance of the situation by describing it as small and tiny.
Phoebe insists that their lives will never be the same again.
Rachel considers talking to Ross before leaving for the airport.
Chandler informs Joey that Ross is in China, preventing Rachel from talking to him.
Monica checks Ross's flight itinerary to confirm his departure time.
Chandler warns Rachel that she won't make it to talk to Ross before his flight.
Rachel decides to go see Ross immediately, expressing her urgency to speak with him.
Chandler declares his love for Rachel and asks her to deal with him first before leaving.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Airport, Ross has headphones on, and is listening to a 'How To Speak Chinese'
tape. Occasionally, he makes an outburst in Chinese in accordance with the tape. He is
getting on the jetway. The flight attendant is there.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (something in Chinese)

dialogue.speaker: FLIGHT ATTENDANT
dialogue.text: Alright!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Ni-chou chi-ma! (walks onto jetway)

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Ross! Excuse me, pardon me, excuse me....

dialogue.speaker: FLIGHT ATTENDANT
dialogue.text: Hi!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Hi.

dialogue.speaker: FLIGHT ATTENDANT
dialogue.text: May I see your boarding pass?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, no, no, I don't have one. I just need to talk to my friend.

dialogue.speaker: FLIGHT ATTENDANT
dialogue.text: Oh, oooh. I'm sorry. You are not allowed on the jetway unless you have a boarding pass.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: No, I know, but I—he just went on. He's right there, he's got the blue jacket on, I... can I j-just...

dialogue.speaker: FLIGHT ATTENDANT
dialogue.text: No no no! Federal regulations!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: OK, alright, OK, um... then could you please, uh... just give him a message for me? Please? This is very important.

dialogue.speaker: FLIGHT ATTENDANT
dialogue.text: Alright. What's the message?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Uh... I don't know.

dialogue.speaker: FLIGHT ATTENDANT
dialogue.text: Sir? Sir? Excuse me, sir? Uh... I have a message for you.

dialogue.speaker: MAN
dialogue.text: (confused) What?

dialogue.speaker: FLIGHT ATTENDANT
dialogue.text: It's from Rachel. She said that she loved the present, and she will see you when you get back.

dialogue.speaker: TO WIFE)
dialogue.text: Toby... Oh, for God's sake, I don't know what she's talking about! There's no Rachel! Don't give me that deep freeze.

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Airport, Ross has headphones on, and is listening to a 'How To Speak Chinese'
tape. Occasionally, he makes an outburst in Chinese in accordance with the tape. He is
getting on the jetway. The flight attendant is there.]

events.event_description: Ross puts on headphones and listens to a 'How To Speak Chinese' tape, occasionally making Chinese outbursts.
Ross makes an outburst in Chinese while getting on the jetway.
Ross walks onto the jetway after making a Chinese outburst.
Rachel attempts to get past the flight attendant to reach her friend on the jetway.
Flight attendant informs Rachel that she cannot go onto the jetway without a boarding pass.
Rachel asks the flight attendant to deliver a message to her friend.
Rachel provides the content of the message to the flight attendant.
Flight attendant delivers the message to the man on the jetway.
Man responds confusedly to the message, denying any knowledge of Rachel.
Man dismisses the message, indicating he does not recognize Rachel and is frustrated.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Joey's Bedroom, he and Melanie are in bed together.]

dialogue.speaker: MELANIE
dialogue.text: Mmmmmm... Oh, Joey, Joey, Joey... I think I blacked out there for a minute!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Heh, heh. It was nothin'.

dialogue.speaker: MELANIE
dialogue.text: Well, now we've gotta find something fun for you! (she starts kissing his chest)

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (panicked) Uhhh.. y'know what? Forget about me. Let's, uh... let's give you another turn.

dialogue.speaker: MELANIE
dialogue.text: (surprised) M-Me again?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Sure! Why not?

dialogue.speaker: MELANIE
dialogue.text: Boy, somebody's gonna get a big fruit basket tomorrow.

dialogue.speaker: MELANIE
dialogue.text: Oooh, I gotta tell you... you are nothing like I thought you would be.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: How do you mean?

dialogue.speaker: MELANIE
dialogue.text: I don't know, I-I guess I just had you pegged as one of those guys who're always 'me, me, me.' But you... you're a giver. You're like the most generous man I ever met. I mean... you're practically a woman.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Joey's Bedroom, he and Melanie are in bed together.]

events.event_description: Melanie comments that she blacked out for a minute during intimacy with Joey.
Joey dismisses Melanie's comment and downplays the situation.
Melanie suggests finding something fun for Joey and begins kissing his chest.
Joey panics and suggests giving Melanie another turn instead of focusing on himself.
Melanie expresses surprise at Joey's suggestion of another turn.
Joey agrees to give Melanie another turn.
Melanie jokes about Joey receiving a big fruit basket the next day.
Melanie comments that Joey is not what she expected and describes him as a generous person.
Melanie compares Joey to a woman, implying he is more giving than stereotypical men.
Joey responds to Melanie's compliment by asking how she means.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica, Phoebe, and Rachel are there. Monica is holding
the wrapping paper from one of Rachel's gifts.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Uh, so, uh, Rach, uh... do you wanna save this wrapping paper, I mean, it's only a little bit torn... so are you gonna go for it with Ross or should I just throw it out?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I don't know. I don't know... I thought about it all the way there, and I thought about it all the way back... and, uh, oh, you guys, y'know, it's Ross . Y'know what I mean? I mean, it's Ross .

dialogue.speaker: MONICA AND PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Sure.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I don't know, I mean, this is just my initial gut feeling... but I'm thinking... oh, I'm thinking it'd be really great.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh my God, me too! Oh! Oh, we'd be like friends-in-law! Y'know what the best part is? The best part is that you already know everything about him! I mean, it's like starting on the fifteenth date!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah, but, y'know, it's... it would be like starting on the fifteenth date.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Another good point.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: No, I mean, I mean, when you're at the fifteenth date, y'know, you're already in a very relationshippy place. Y'know, it's... you're committed.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (confused) Huh?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Well, I mean, then what happens if it doesn't work out?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Why isn't it working out?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I don't know... sometimes it doesn't.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Is he not cute enough for you?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: No!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Does he not make enough money?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: No, I'm just....

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Maybe there's someone else.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Wha...

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Is there? Is there someone else?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: No! There is.. there is noone else!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Then why the hell are you dumping my brother?!?

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica, Phoebe, and Rachel are there. Monica is holding
the wrapping paper from one of Rachel's gifts.]

events.event_description: Monica holds a torn wrapping paper from one of Rachel's gifts and asks Rachel if she wants to save it or throw it out.
Rachel expresses uncertainty about her feelings regarding her relationship with Ross, mentioning she has thought about it during her commute.
Monica suggests that Rachel and Ross could become 'friends-in-law' and comments on how well Rachel knows Ross.
Phoebe agrees with Monica, stating that starting a relationship after the fifteenth date indicates a committed relationship.
Phoebe questions what happens if the relationship doesn't work out after being at a 'fifteenth date' level of commitment.
Monica asks Rachel if Ross is not cute enough for her.
Rachel denies that Ross is not attractive or financially sufficient, indicating her feelings are elsewhere.
Phoebe suggests that there might be someone else involved in Rachel's feelings.
Rachel denies the presence of anyone else, asserting there is no one else involved.
Monica questions why Rachel is considering ending her relationship with Ross if there is no other person involved.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is eating breakfast, Joey quietly opens his
bedroom door.]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Hey, big...

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Shhhh!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (quietly) ...spender.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: She's still asleep.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: So how'd it go?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Oh, it was amazing. You know how you always think you're great in bed?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: The fact that you'd even ask that question shows how little you know me.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Well, it's like, last night, I couldn't do the thing that usually makes me great. So I had to do all this other stuff. And the response I got... man, oh man, it was like a ticker tape parade!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yes, I know, as it happens my room is very very close to the parade route.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: It was amazing! And not just for her... uh-uh. For me, too. It's like, all of a sudden, I'm blind. But all my other senses are heightened, y'know? It's like... I was able to appreciate it on another level.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I didn't know you had another level.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I know! Neither did I!

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is eating breakfast, Joey quietly opens his
bedroom door.]

events.event_description: Joey quietly opens his bedroom door.
Chandler asks Joey how his night went.
Joey responds that his night was amazing and describes his experience.
Chandler comments on Joey's question showing his lack of knowledge about himself.
Joey explains that he couldn't perform his usual act but did other things, receiving a positive response.
Chandler makes a sarcastic remark about the parade happening near his room.
Joey describes feeling like he's blind but with heightened other senses, leading to a new appreciation.
Chandler comments on Joey having another level he was unaware of.
Joey admits he was unaware of this other level himself.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, one week later. Monica is seated, Rachel comes out of her
bedroom.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Hey, great skirt! Birthday present?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh, from who?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: From you. I exchanged the blouse you got me.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Well, it's the thought. Hey, doesn't Ross's flight get in in a couple hours? At gate 27-B?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Uh, yeah. Uh, Monica, y'know, honey, I've been thinking about it and I've decided this—this whole Ross thing, it's just not a good idea.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh, why?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Because, I feel like I wouldn't just be going out with him. I would be going out with all of you. Oh, and there would just be all this pressure, and I don't wanna...

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (gets up) No, no, no, no, no, no pressure, no pressure!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Monica, nothing has even happened yet, and you're already so...

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I am not 'so'! OK, I was a teensy bit weird at first, but... I'll be good. I promise.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Who is it?

dialogue.speaker: INTERCOM
dialogue.text: It's me, Carl.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: C'mon up.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Behind my brother's back? (Rachel glares at her) ... is exactly the kind of crazy thing you won't be hearing from me.

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, one week later. Monica is seated, Rachel comes out of her
bedroom.]

events.event_description: Rachel shows Monica a skirt and confirms it is a birthday present.
Rachel admits the skirt was a gift from Monica and exchanged her blouse.
Monica asks Rachel about Ross's flight arriving at gate 27-B.
Rachel expresses her decision that she doesn't want to pursue a relationship with Ross due to pressure and complications.
Monica questions why Rachel feels that way about dating Ross.
Rachel explains her feelings about the potential pressure of dating Ross and all his friends.
Monica gets up and insists there is no pressure involved in dating Ross.
Rachel states that nothing has happened yet and criticizes Monica for being already so involved.
Intercom announces Carl is arriving and Rachel invites him to come up.
Monica comments on Rachel's decision to have Carl come up behind her brother's back, implying disapproval.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is seated, and the apartment is filled with
baskets of fruit. Joey enters, check in hand.]

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Seven hundred bucks!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Alright, you did it! Do we have any fruit?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Man, hell of a two weeks, huh? Y'know what, though? I really feel like I learned something.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Really? So, you're gonna stick with this 'it's all for her' thing?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: What, are you crazy? When a blind man gets his sight back, does he walk around like this? (Joey closes his eyes and walks around with arms spread.)

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is seated, and the apartment is filled with
baskets of fruit. Joey enters, check in hand.]

events.event_description: Joey enters Chandler and Joey's apartment holding a check.
Joey exclaims, 'Seven hundred bucks!'
Chandler responds, 'Alright, you did it! Do we have any fruit?'
Joey comments on the past two weeks, saying, 'Man, hell of a two weeks, huh? Y'know what, though? I really feel like I learned something.'
Chandler questions Joey about his motivation, asking, 'Really? So, you're gonna stick with this 'it's all for her' thing?'
Joey demonstrates his ignorance by closing his eyes and walking around with arms spread, mimicking someone who has regained sight.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's Balcony, Rachel is having drinks with her date, Carl.]

dialogue.speaker: CARL
dialogue.text: I'm just sayin', if I see one more picture of Ed Begley, Jr. in that stupid electric car, I'm gonna shoot myself! I mean, don't get me wrong... I'm not against environmental issues per se .... it's just that guy!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I can't believe you'd rather go out with him than me.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Would you excuse me, please? I'm trying to have a date here.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Fine, just stop thinking about me.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Can't do it, can you?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: So I'm thinking about you. So what?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I don't get it. What do you see in this guy, anyway?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Well... he happens to be a very nice... guy....

dialogue.speaker: CARL
dialogue.text: I mean, come on, buddy, get a real car !

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Rachel, come on. Give us a chance.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Ross, it's too hard.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No, no, no... why, because it might get weird for everyone else? Who cares about them. This is about us. Look, I-I've been in love with you since, like, the ninth grade.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Ross, you're like my best friend.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I know.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: If we broke up, and I lost you...

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Whoa, whoa, whoa. What makes you think we're gonna break up?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Well, have you been involved with someone where you haven't broken up?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (pause) No. But... it only has to happen once . Look, you and I both know we are perfect for each other, right? I mean... so, the only question is... are you attracted to me?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I don't know... I mean, I've never looked at you that way before.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Well, start looking.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Wow.

dialogue.speaker: CARL
dialogue.text: Exactly! And you just know I'm gonna be the guy caught behind this hammerhead in traffic!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Right! You're right!

dialogue.speaker: CARL
dialogue.text: Heh... y'know?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: You know what?

dialogue.speaker: CARL
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I forgot... I am supposed to pick up a friend at the airport. I am so sorry! I'm so... if you want to stay, and finish your drinks, please do.... (gives him her drink) I mean—I'm sorry. I-I-I gotta go. I'm sorry.

dialogue.speaker: CARL
dialogue.text: But...

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's Balcony, Rachel is having drinks with her date, Carl.]

events.event_description: Carl criticizes electric cars and expresses frustration about Ed Begley, Jr.'s electric car in a humorous rant.
Ross confesses to Rachel that he cannot believe she prefers Carl over him.
Rachel asks to be excused from the conversation to focus on her date.
Ross questions Rachel about her feelings for Carl and suggests she is thinking about him.
Rachel admits Carl is a very nice guy, implying her positive feelings towards him.
Ross urges Rachel to give their relationship a chance, revealing his long-standing love for her.
Rachel expresses her concern about the difficulty of their relationship.
Ross reassures Rachel that their relationship is worth the risk and confesses his love for her since ninth grade.
Rachel considers Ross's declaration and admits she has never looked at him that way before.
Rachel abruptly excuses herself, claiming she needs to pick up a friend at the airport, and leaves the scene.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Airport. Madonna's Take A Bow plays in the background as Rachel waits at
the gate with flowers.]

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (sifting through crowd) Excuse me, pardon me, excuse me, excuse me, sorry. Hi.

dialogue.speaker: MAN
dialogue.text: For God's sake, will you let it go? There's no Rachel!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh, hey, hey, I got that.

dialogue.speaker: JULIE
dialogue.text: Oh, thanks, sweetie.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No problem. I cannot wait for you to meet my friends.

dialogue.speaker: JULIE
dialogue.text: Really?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: JULIE
dialogue.text: You don't think they'll judge and ridicule me?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No, no, they will. I just... uh...

dialogue.speaker: ROSS AND JULIE
dialogue.text: Can't wait.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Come on, they're gonna love you.

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Airport. Madonna's Take A Bow plays in the background as Rachel waits at
the gate with flowers.]

events.event_description: Rachel attempts to navigate through the crowd at the airport gate.
Rachel says 'Hi' to someone in the crowd.
The MAN tells Rachel that there is no Rachel present.
Ross acknowledges the MAN's statement about Rachel.
Ross accepts a flower from Julie.
Ross expresses excitement about Julie meeting his friends.
Julie expresses concern about being judged and ridiculed by Ross's friends.
Ross reassures Julie that his friends will love her, despite his earlier hesitation.
Ross and Julie share a moment of anticipation about meeting his friends.
Rachel continues to wait at the gate with flowers as background music plays.
